docs.abstract: Manufacturing activity fell to its lowest level in more than a decade, a sign of fallout from President Trump’s trade war.
docs.snippet: Manufacturing activity fell to its lowest level in more than a decade, a sign of fallout from President Trump’s trade war.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — American manufacturing activity contracted last month more than it had in a decade, data released Friday showed, a sign that economic damage from President Trump’s trade war could linger even after the United States and China sign an initial trade deal.

headline.main: U.S. Manufacturing Slumps as Trade War Damage Lingers
headline.print_headline: Manufacturing Has Slumped  To Decade Low

byline.original: By Ana Swanson and Jeanna Smialek

docs.abstract: The former official in New York sent sexually explicit messages to a boy named “Colton,” who was in fact an undercover officer, the charges said.
docs.snippet: The former official in New York sent sexually explicit messages to a boy named “Colton,” who was in fact an undercover officer, the charges said.
docs.lead_paragraph: David Hay was a high-ranking official with the New York City Department of Education when he went on a dating app last July and found someone named Colton, whom Mr. Hay believed to be a 14-year-old boy living in a small Wisconsin city, federal prosecutors said.

headline.main: Top Education Official Planned to Meet Boy for Sex, Prosecutors Say
headline.print_headline: Top Education Official Planned to Meet Boy for Sex, Prosecutors Say

byline.original: By Eliza Shapiro and William K. Rashbaum

docs.abstract: For half his life, he has watched himself portrayed as someone he is not.
docs.snippet: For half his life, he has watched himself portrayed as someone he is not.
docs.lead_paragraph: Depersonalization is a dissociative disorder characterized by a sense of observing one’s self from outside one’s body. Those with the condition often report an experience akin to watching yourself in a movie. My 86-year-old stepfather, Chuckie O’Brien, does not suffer from depersonalization. But for more than half his life, 44 years, he has watched himself portrayed in news articles, books and motion pictures — most recently, in Martin Scorsese’s “The Irishman” — as someone he is not. The effect on his life has been devastating.

docs.abstract: We love to talk about great movie writing. But the best screenplay categories are rarely judged on the words alone.
docs.snippet: We love to talk about great movie writing. But the best screenplay categories are rarely judged on the words alone.
docs.lead_paragraph: This is a story about the screenwriting Oscars and who’ll probably lose them. But in order to tell it, let’s go back to the 1983 Oscars, when the five original screenplay nominees were “Diner,” “E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial,” “Gandhi,” “An Officer and a Gentleman” and “Tootsie.” Even with no “Personal Best,” “Smash Palace” or “Shoot the Moon”: a good year! Although, I’d have no problem boiling the five down to “E.T.” and “Tootsie,” and I’m not going to choose between them, because I don’t have to. (O.K. Fine. “Tootsie.”) And yet, John Briley won for “Gandhi.” But how did anybody know that was the best screenplay? Who read it?

headline.main: The Mystery of the Oscars: How Do You Really Vote for a Script?

docs.abstract: As record fires rage, the country’s leaders seem intent on sending it to its doom.
docs.snippet: As record fires rage, the country’s leaders seem intent on sending it to its doom.
docs.lead_paragraph: BRUNY ISLAND, Australia — Australia today is ground zero for the climate catastrophe. Its glorious Great Barrier Reef is dying, its world-heritage rain forests are burning, its giant kelp forests have largely vanished, numerous towns have run out of water or are about to, and now the vast continent is burning on a scale never before seen.

docs.abstract: He was an important figure. But the Islamic Republic won’t lose influence in the region.
docs.snippet: He was an important figure. But the Islamic Republic won’t lose influence in the region.
docs.lead_paragraph: The assassination of Maj. Gen. Qassim Suleimani of Iran by the United States was an unprecedented escalation in the 40-year standoff between the two countries. General Suleimani was the powerful head of Iran’s Islamic Revolutionary Guards Corps’ special operations forces, the Quds Force, and we can expect retaliation across the region. But the killing will not in itself weaken the Revolutionary Guards or Iran’s role in the region.

headline.main: Suleimani’s Death Changes Nothing for Iran

docs.abstract: The case could end the Affordable Care Act, but keeping the issue in the public eye could help them politically.
docs.snippet: The case could end the Affordable Care Act, but keeping the issue in the public eye could help them politically.
docs.lead_paragraph: A group of Democratic state officials and the Democratic-led House of Representatives on Friday asked the Supreme Court to take up a case with the potential to wipe away the entire Affordable Care Act.

headline.main: Democrats Ask Supreme Court for Quick Decision on Obamacare
headline.print_headline: Democrats Ask Justices for Quick Ruling on A.C.A.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)

docs.abstract: Here’s a quick guide with everything you need to know for the Hollywood Foreign Press Association film and television awards.
docs.snippet: Here’s a quick guide with everything you need to know for the Hollywood Foreign Press Association film and television awards.
docs.lead_paragraph: The 77th annual Golden Globes will be handed out Sunday at the Beverly Hilton in Beverly Hills. With Ricky Gervais returning for a fifth time as the host and the awards’ general reputation for being unpredictable, it should be an interesting night. Here’s how to watch the show and other details to get up to speed:

headline.main: How to Watch the Golden Globes on Sunday

docs.abstract: Corrections that appeared in print on Friday, Jan. 3, 2020.
docs.snippet: Corrections that appeared in print on Friday, Jan. 3, 2020.
docs.lead_paragraph: An article on Tuesday about Carlos Ghosn’s escape from Japan misstated the total amount Carlos Ghosn paid in bail. It was 1.5 billion yen, or about $13.8 million, not $9 million. The error was repeated in two other articles on Wednesday.
